client

Class ProxyClient

  • java.lang.Object
    • client.ProxyClient
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.rmi.Remote, SharedProxyClient

    public final class ProxyClient
extends java.lang.Object
implements SharedProxyClient

    This class implements SharedProxyClient and all its methods, making them interact with the correct view components (if they are local) or routing them with the correct parameters to the server (if they are remote)


    This class implements the singleton design pattern, having just one instance of it available per JVM; this instance can be accessed through the static class' methods.


    Before calling getInstance(), a client using this class should first set the Connection attribute by calling setConnection(Connection)

    See Also:
    SharedProxyClient, Connection

      static void setConnection(Connection c)
      Set the Connection attribute held by ths class, to either a NetworkSocket or a NetworkRmi instance with transparency, thanks to the implementation of the Connection. interface
      If the parameter c is an instance of NetworkRmi, the method NetworkRmi.remotize(Object, Integer) is called on the private class attribute instance, making it exportable over RMI

    • Method Detail

      • getInstance

        public static ProxyClient getInstance()
        Obtain a reference to the class' instance
        Returns:
        always the same instance, saved as a private static reference in the class

      • setConnection

        public static void setConnection(Connection c)
        Set the Connection attribute held by ths class, to either a NetworkSocket or a NetworkRmi instance with transparency, thanks to the implementation of the Connection. interface
        If the parameter c is an instance of NetworkRmi, the method NetworkRmi.remotize(Object, Integer) is called on the private class attribute instance, making it exportable over RMI
        Parameters:
        c - an instance implementing the Connection interface; if provided argument is of type NetworkSocket then an internal flag isSocket is set

      • getConnection

        public static Connection getConnection()
        Getter method to obtain the saved Connection attribute
        Returns:
        internal class' connection, if set; otherwise returns null

      • startGame

        public java.lang.String startGame(java.lang.String nick)
        Remote
        When this method is called, it sets up the correct connection environment based on the player's decision (RMI or socket). In practice, the instance of the ProxyClient class on the client is exported on the server's RMI registry, or on the client's hash map inside the NetworkSocket class, to let the server call the ProxyClient's methods
        Specified by:
        startGame in interface SharedProxyClient
        Parameters:
        nick - String
        Returns:
        String
        See Also:
        SharedProxyClient.startGame(String)
